byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Pakistan announces that aid agency Save the Children can continue its work in country but on smaller scale and under stricter financial scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: Pressure from Western allies will allow the aid agency to continue its operations, though on a smaller scale and with tighter restrictions.

headline.main: Reversing Course, Pakistan Says Save the Children Can Stay
headline.print_headline: Reversing Course, Pakistan Says Save the Children Can Stay

snippet: Pressure from Western allies will allow the aid agency to continue its operations, though on a smaller scale and with tighter restrictions.
